reviews.review_msg: You need to memorize Hanyu Pinyin and tone marks. That's all that matters in the class. The assignment instructions are unclear, and her grading system is also somewhat questionable. But you cannot complain about this since she wouldn't give you a clear answer even though you sent her an email. but overall, she's not the worst prof
Multiple weekly assignments and quizzes are a lot of work but help with language retention in the long run, so it's not that bad. She doesn't quiz you on things you haven't seen in the course before.

Took this as an asynchronous class so unfortunately I only had x1 class a week with a TA (who was not good at all). If you fall behind, good luck... almost weekly quizzes and tests. Final exams (especially the speaking and listening sections) are impossible to do and imo not even the classwork prepares you for them.

I don't know what to say. Although the overall content of the course is easy to understand but the way how she grades are kinda making me sad. Getting one wrong on the question will bring your grade dramatically down. Everyone says its GPA booster but tbh it was pretty annoying course to even get a A-. There might be better option for GPA booster

Be ready to learn pinyin if you are in this class. Her tests require you to write in pinyin rather than actually characters. She also does not acknowledge different dialects and if you give a different pronunciation during the oral test you will not get marks for it.

Very nice and approachable for asking questions. Course builds a lot off of CHIN100.

I have no background with Chinese before I took CHIN100, and I really enjoyed both CHIN100 and 110. This course does take quite a bit of time for studying, repetition for learning characters is very important. There's weekly quizzes, make sure to study beforehand.

-took both CHIN 100 & 110 (101) w/Prof. Ng
-inconsistent and harsh marking
-time for oral exams was ALWAYS shorter than promised
-online platform not great
-in person tutorials very content heavy(necessary to go to)
-occasionally would be tested on words we did not know/cover
-good at responding to emails
-multiple places for assignments(confusing)

I took this class out of interest towards Mandarin. However, this course ruined everything. Do not take this course unless you are an enthusiastic Chinese that pretends not to know anything in mandarin. Because of such students, you will get demotivated as you will work hard and yet get bad grades. TA is good, but again the environment is not

She uses words that she doesn't teach, tells you that you don't need to know something and then tests you on it. Lots of errors throughout the course material. Grading is shady, she'll never show you anything other than the mark. Grading system is flawed, some letters have a 4% range, some have 5%. If you don't know a different dialect, don't take.

I'm in my 3rd  Chinese course with Billie (Wu laoshi) and my experience has been positive overall. Although the course isn't perfect, she genuinely cares about student experience. There's am emphasis on showing what you know, so she gives part marks.
The content in 101 is much more challenging than 100, but not unfairly so. I recommend.

CHIN100 steadily increases in difficulty as you go along, but with enough practice I think you will be fine. Billie is a tough marker, and I felt I often had to ask for points which she should have given in the first place. I don't feel that the workload of this course was too much, but it is maladjusted to online format.

a lot of work for the type of course. The one person who is doing the best and is answering most questions is also Chinese... Says that it isn't based on tests but my mark was bad cuz of them. First class said she won't be picky with details on exam and gave me a bad grade because of "the details." I want to learn chinese but this ain't it.

Do not take this course with Billie after CHIN 100 if you are looking for an easy mark. Impossible to get high marks compared to CHIN 100 unless you are a Chinese. Only Chinese people who were born here but pretend to not know any Chinese get A's. Will not take any other CHIN courses at SFU because of how poorly Billie managed with the course

She is just a professor with horrible teaching ability. Would speak so fast that anyone who is not Chinese cannot understand what she is saying, but only the ethnic Chinese people can understand her and accomplish her tasks with high marks. She would check her background which is meaningless af because ethnic Chinese can obviously understand her
The class was more intense than CHIN100 but you learn a lot. Not too difficult if you did well in CHIN100. Be careful though, she tries to find ways to take as much marks off as possible.

DISCLAIMER: Billie did not teach this class but her TA Ms.Tang did, however it showed on SIS that Billie was teaching so ya anyways Ms. Tang was awesome and got me so excited about Chinese I always wanted to go to class! she expects a lot from you but she's so lovely my whole class loved her, honestly the best class ive taken!

This class is easy! i don't understand why there are so many negative comments. There are quizzes which are easy if you read the textbook and as for the vocab quizzes, just memorize what she tells you to memorize and you will get a 100%

I don't want to continue with Chinese anymore, she makes it very difficult to learn. She's nice but she doesn't really care much if you improve or not. There's a lot of work involved and the blog thing is just ridiculous. She said she MAY or MAY NOT mark it but she encouraged us to update it...

Seems like she doesn't care about teaching anymore. Her textbook is not that great and kind of useless. She's nice but she doesn't seem to care if we know the pronunciation or not, which is the most important part of the Chinese language. I liked Jia Fei much better.

This is a slightly-better-than-average course. Billie teaches clearly and is helpful. However, getting a perfect score on a written assignment is harder than wringing water from stone. I feel her expectations are too high. Had my Chinese been perfect, I would not be taking this course in the first place. An A or an A+ seems to be out of reach.

The oral exam could be very difficult for those who have difficulty in listening her pronounciation. Also,there is no opportunity to practice this by yourself. She requires high level of chinese literacy prior to this class. It is quite unfair to whom has no or less chinese background.

I took her class. I felt the way she teaches was unclear. I cannot understand why every one must buy her home-made $35 textbook.I reather prefer buying textbooks published by universities.It's much more useful.I didn't see any point of taking this class to improve chinese. She was too picky, never give you full mark for any assignment.

An absolutely great prof! Very passionate about teaching and very helpful too! She also shares a great deal of her life experiences with traveling around the world and it totally made me interested to travel to China to learn more Chinese!

She is a good teacher. Very helpful, in class quizes are easy if you study for it. The Chinese book didn't have a lot of chapters which is good. She does pick on students for answers in class, but she isn't mean if you don't know the answer. It is fun, class is always interesting. Presentations are present fotr this class.

I took a few classes w/ her & I have to say that I've never hated any prof this much.She pretends to be a goddess but if she hates u, u r doom. Me, never done anything wrong, attend every class on time, done all my works, I swear w/ my own life, but she just hated me. She will try to pick on me. All I can say, she plays favoritism, so I was unlucky
Great teacher!

if you have a knack for languages, then this class is for you! Billie is really fun and warm hearted. She designed the class herself, I found the layout very organized and systematic. The end of the class is challenging...you may want to find chinese friends for help!
WORST COURSE I'VE EVER TAKEN
very tough
Not very interesting course.

This is a great course and she is a great prof. No, she did not give easy marks.  To those who are taking this course to learn, we had to work very hard.  You will learn a lot.  Those who are taking this course for easy credit should not be in this course in the first place.
Be careful as she can be very tough.

I took this course simply it is too asy. She gave higher marks to please students. Her pronunciation seems not standard Chinese, cus it is different from what i heard from tapes. how can she teach at the university level???
VERY GOOD AND NICE PROF!! easy quizzes easy assignments easy finals.  orals are not hard either!!!
Excellent prof.  She is enthusiastic about the material, and explains the content very clearly.  This course was always fun to attend... definitely recommend this prof.
Is CHIN 152 ever going to be offer again?
Best teacher I ever had!!! You can see that she totally enjoys teaching and that's the type of teacher that we need. She makes learning FUN!
The oral exam is very difficult. She needs the pronouncation requirements so high. If I have high level on pronouncation,  I don't need to take this course !!!!! And hard writing final exam.
Great class, interesting material, and very nice prof. Try to be keen though cuz she knows who is late and talking in the back of the class.
No Comments
No Comments
She's an awesome teacher, the material isn't hard... she's soo nice and cheerful and makes the class interesting by telling neat things relevant to the course
Very nice teacher. But try not to goof around cuz she notices...
great teacher!!!
So pleasant. Always smiling. So proud of Chinese Culture. Strict during tests.
super friendly
very nice and cheerful.  makes the class enjoyable
No Comments
